title: Quiz 10: Special Groups - Rape, Disability, FP
description: Assess knowledge on counselling rape victims, people with disabilities, and family planning clients.

questions.question: Which of the following are common emotional reactions of a rape victim? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Rape causes severe trauma, shame, fear, and self-blame.

questions.question: Order the logical steps of a medical examination for a rape victim:
questions.explanation: General body -> Clothes -> Specific Genital Exam -> Specimens.

questions.question: It is NOT necessary to refer a rape victim for VCT (HIV testing) or prophylactic ARVs.
questions.explanation: Rape carries a high risk of HIV transmission; PEP (Post-Exposure Prophylaxis) and testing are critical.

questions.question: Which principle of counselling people with disabilities involves addressing the loss of productivity and dependency?
questions.explanation: Practical impact relates to work capacity and daily living. Emotional impact relates to feelings of dependency.

questions.question: In Family Planning counselling (GATHER), what happens during the 'Explain' stage?

options.text: Demonstrate fully how to use the selected method
Tell them about all available methods

questions.explanation: Explain focuses on the *specific* selected methodâ€”how to use it effectively.

questions.question: A disability or chronic illness affects not just the individual but the whole ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Disability has a social impact on the entire family unit.

questions.question: Why is it important to 'Confront the Reality' when counselling someone with a disability?

options.text: So they can learn realistic coping mechanisms

questions.explanation: Accepting reality is the first step to adaptation and finding workable solutions.

questions.question: Match the GATHER step for Family Planning to its action:

pairs.right: Discuss family needs and prior knowledge
Assist in making an informed choice

questions.explanation: Ask = Assess; Tell = Inform; Help = Decide; Return = Follow-up.

questions.question: If a rape victim is found to be pregnant, what options might be discussed (depending on laws/ethics)? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Termination, adoption, or parenting are valid options. Forced marriage is never an option.

questions.question: What type of language should be used when counselling people with disabilities to avoid blame?
questions.explanation: Treat the patient as a human being first; avoid language that creates guilt or blame.
